meanings.definition: To crunch or squeeze something into a compact mass.
meanings.sent1: I enjoy scrunching paper into tiny balls.
meanings.sent2: She was scrunching the leaves under her feet as she walked.
meanings.sent3: The cat was scrunching up the wrapping paper into a mess.
meanings.sent4: The car tires were scrunching gravel as it drove away.
meanings.sent5: The toddler was scrunching playdough into different shapes.

meanings.definition: To make a noise by crushing or grinding something.
meanings.sent1: The old floorboards were scrunching under our weight.
meanings.sent2: I heard the snow scrunching beneath my boots.
meanings.sent3: The bag of chips was scrunching loudly in the quiet room.
meanings.sent4: The gears were scrunching as the machine struggled to start.
meanings.sent5: The leaves were scrunching as the wind blew through the trees.

meanings.sent1: She was scrunching her nose in distaste.
meanings.sent2: The paper was scrunching in his hand as he nervously waited.
meanings.sent3: The blanket was scrunching up at the foot of the bed.
meanings.sent4: The fabric was scrunching awkwardly as she tried to fold it neatly.
meanings.sent5: The plastic bag was scrunching noisily as she crumpled it up.
